examples: But how many itinerants can support themselves on YouTube earnings, like Bob Wells?
But how many itinerants can support themselves on YouTube earnings, like Bob Wells?
The streets are full of itinerant traders selling trinkets and people bustling from place to place.
And she's a real survivor in this movie about a woman who goes on the road, some kind of an itinerant 21st century worker, beautifully directed by Chloe Zhao.
words.defineEn: traveling from place to place to work
words.defineVi: đi từ nơi này đến nơi khác để làm việc

examples: We found the President's itinerary in your desk.
We only know a quarter, at most, probably less, a fraction, really, of what they have got up to, based on their travel plans, their itinerary, right?
When I got the itinerary from the Thunderbirds, and I started reading stuff, and it said things like, get plenty of sleep, I was like, oh, I haven't really done that.
words.defineEn: a plan of the route and the places that one will visit on a journey
words.defineVi: một kế hoạch của tuyến đường và những nơi mà một người sẽ ghé thăm trên một hành trình

words.defineEn: travel from place to place, as for work
words.defineVi: du lịch từ nơi này đến nơi khác, như đối với công việc

words.defineEn: large and roomy (`convenient' is archaic in this sense)
words.defineVi: lớn và rộng rãi ("thuận tiện" là cổ xưa theo nghĩa này)

examples: Additionally, falling prices for key commodities, like copper, are keeping a lid on most manufacturing costs.
These commodity monies didn’t require much trust.
It's a commodity.
Cause oil's a valuable commodity.
But commodity money isn’t very convenient.
words.defineEn: (economics) a basic product or raw material that can be purchased or sold
words.defineVi: (kinh tế học) sản phẩm cơ bản hoặc nguyên liệu thô có thể mua hoặc bán

words.defineEn: a small wave on the surface of a liquid
words.defineVi: một làn sóng nhỏ trên bề mặt chất lỏng

examples: We must stand fast and not waver in our commitment to the cause.
The president never wavered.
He has never wavered, he never, never backs down.
I will never waver in that conviction, I promise you.
And BMW has at times appeared to waver in its commitment to electric vehicles.
words.defineEn: to move in a rhythmic or repetitive pattern that rises and falls
words.defineVi: để di chuyển trong một mô hình nhịp nhàng hoặc lặp đi lặp lại tăng và giảm

examples: And so we like to move through space and time using our bodies, and we don't want to be encumbered by clothing.
words.defineEn: to make it so that doing something or the happening of something becomes difficult
words.defineVi: để làm cho nó để làm một cái gì đó hoặc xảy ra một cái gì đó trở nên khó khăn
một mối quan tâm khó khăn hoặc khó khăn

examples: The city has put the brakes on further spending.
Further details can be found on our website.
He hung tight for 50 minutes, awaiting further instructions.
I think any further intervention would be unwise at this stage of the game.
It gets colder as you travel further north.
words.defineVi: thúc đẩy sự tăng trưởng của

examples: We can trace its odoriferous origins back to the single-celled organisms who sampled Earth’s most primordial perfumes.

words.defineEn: having odor or a characteristic odor
words.defineVi: có mùi hoặc mùi đặc trưng

examples: The quality of our reporting and the accuracy of our stories are a reflection of our commitment to the truth and our dedication to our craft.
The quality of your work is a reflection of the effort you put in.
He caught a glimpse of his reflection in the glass.
With him came a difference in style, a change of gear, a time for reflection and taking stock.
Last year, she was out at the elbows, wearing clothes with visible tears and faded colors, a reflection of the financial challenges she faced.
words.defineEn: the phenomenon of a propagating wave (light or sound) being thrown back from a surface
words.defineVi: hiện tượng sóng lan truyền (ánh sáng hoặc âm thanh) bị ném trở lại từ một bề mặt

examples: Or sometimes called parabolic reflectors.
The sea ice is a natural reflector.
So you have optical corner reflectors for the Leica total station here.
You have metal mechanical corner reflectors for the interfermetric radar?
And that reflector area is called the tapetum.
words.defineEn: a photographic accessory used to redirect or bounce light onto a subject, typically consisting of a flat or curved surface made of reflective material
words.defineVi: một phụ kiện chụp ảnh được sử dụng để chuyển hướng hoặc chiếu ánh sáng vào đối tượng, thường bao gồm một bề mặt phẳng hoặc cong làm bằng vật liệu phản chiếu
đưa ra hoặc phát ra (cũng ẩn dụ)

examples: So the effusion rate of the gas is important.
And there's mechanical lag associated with the effusion rate, or the head pressure is what it's called.
See, most volcanic eruptions on Mars are what’s known as effusive, meaning the lava flows out of volcanoes and down its sides, all while staying on the ground.

words.defineEn: the process of helping something grow, develop, or become more successful
words.defineVi: quá trình giúp một cái gì đó phát triển, phát triển, hoặc trở nên thành công hơn
